questions.question: We ..................................... molecular biology this semester.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about actions or situations that are going on at the moment of speaking or 'around now'.

questions.question: Mike ...................................... with his grandmother.
questions.description: Simple present is used to talk about facts and more permanent situations.

questions.question: I ...................................... my grandparents last week.
questions.description: We use the past simple to talk about finished events in the past.

questions.question: Did Rahul ................................  another window yesterday?
questions.description: After do, does and did, the verb is used in its infinitive form.

questions.question: I .................................... to all the continents in the world.
questions.description: To talk about things that we have experienced in life, we use the present perfect tense.

questions.question: I ...................................... many setbacks in life.
questions.description: To talk about things that we have experienced in life, we use the present perfect tense.

questions.question: I ……………………………………… to Shyam for ten years.
questions.description: To talk about a life experience that started in the past and has continued up to the present, we use a present perfect.

questions.question: .................................. have you lived in Chennai?
questions.description: Questions in the present perfect usually begin with ‘How long…?’ or ‘Have you ever…?’

questions.question: We ………………………………… in this city for 25 years.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous tense is used to talk about actions and situations that started in the past and have continued up to the present.

questions.question: I ……………………………….. the plants.  What should I do now?
questions.description: The present perfect tense is used to talk about finished events. The present perfect continuous tense cannot be used to talk about finished events.

questions.question: I …………………………………. my homework. Can I watch TV now?
questions.description: The present perfect tense is used to talk about finished events. The present perfect continuous tense cannot be used to talk about finished events.

questions.question: I ………………………………. a bath when the telephone …………………………………..
questions.description: We use the past simple to talk about a short action that happens in the middle of a long action.
